channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AR
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AR

Report X-2023080184

  • State: AR

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG CAME OFF OF TRAILER LEAKING AND WAS IMMEDIATELY GIVEN TO QA DescribePack: ONE JUG OF METHANOL STAIN AND A LOOSE CAP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN HAZMAT TOTE LINED WITH PLASTIC

item.title: Report E-2023070939
item.description:
Report E-2023070939

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-18T21:11:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-13
  • City: DARDANELLE
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 13, 2023, one (1) 125-gallon tote of UN2428 was damaged due to improper bracing during transit and released approximately thirty (30) gallons of product to the gravel, trailer, and soil. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Enhanced Environmental & Emergency (E3) to remediate the impacted surfaces. Crews deployed poly sheeting to the impacted area and diluted the product with water. E3 personnel transferred the contents of the tote using a gravity transfer into a new tote. The tote was properly label and repalletized for continued processing and shipping. Crews utilized absorbent pads to remove residual products and insure cleaning of the impacted cargo .A pressure washer was used to clean the outside of the trailer. All spent absorbents and impacted tote were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for transport and disposal

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071163 SequenceEvent: Fully regulated damaged hazmat package was found in unloading area DescribePack: Upon inspection one of the containers of Micro Kill disinfectant cleaner and deodorizer had a loose cap which had caused an internal leakage inside of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fully regulated damaged hazmat package was placed in a hazmat plastic bag. 2. X-2023071165 SequenceEvent: Fully regulated damage package was found in unloading area DescribePack: Upon inspection one of the containers of micro kill Q3 concentrated disinfectant cleaner and deodorizer had a loose cap which had caused an internal leakage inside of the box DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Fully regulated damage package was placed inside of a plastic hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2023061348
item.description:
Report X-2023061348

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO LEAKING PACKAGE AT LOAKING BAY. RESPONDER FOLLOWED DECISION TREE AND FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CLEANING UP SPILL. PACAKGE AND CONTENTS WERE PLACED IN DMN TRAY AND TAKEN TO DMN PROCESSING CENTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
